intro: Gilia achilleifolia, commonly known as the showy gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Gilia achilleifolia is known for its ability to thrive in arid environments and is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value.
